bills.title: Relates to matching funds for grants under the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program
bills.summary: Permits support from contiguous areas to provide required matching funds for grants under the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to matching funds for grants under the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program

bills.title: Relating to assessment exemptions for living quarters for a parent or grandparent
bills.summary: Relates to assessment exemptions for living quarters for a parent or grandparent.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to assessment exemptions for living quarters for a parent or grandparent

bills.title: Permits senior citizens whose spouses are deceased to substitute a more recent income for purposes of determining eligibility for the enhanced STAR exemption
bills.summary: Permits senior citizens whose spouses are deceased to substitute a more recent income for purposes of determing eligibility for the enhanced school tax relief (STAR) exemption.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to permitting senior citizens whose spouses are deceased to substitute a more recent year's income for purposes of determining eligibility for the enhanced exemption for school tax relief

bills.title: Provides that where a senior citizen purchases real property after the taxable status date, such person shall be eligible for the enhanced STAR exemption
bills.summary: Provides that where a person who meets the requirements for an enhanced exemption for property owned by senior citizens purchases real property after the levy of taxes, such person may file an application for exemption to the assessor within thirty days of the transfer of title to such person for such exemption.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to eligibility for the enhanced school tax relief exemption for senior citizens for properties purchased after the levy of taxes

bills.title: Provides for cost of living and marriage penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage
bills.summary: Provides for cost-of-living and marriage penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to cost of living and marriage penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage

meetings.notes: Please note Room change for this meeting
nTHE COMMITTEE WILL CONSIDER THE FOLLOWING NOMINATION:nnNirav Ramesh Shah, M.D., M.P.HnCommissioner, Department of Health

bills.title: Establishes the New York state veterans' cemetery operation and maintenance fund
bills.summary: Establishes the New York state veterans' cemetery operation and maintenance fund to provide moneys for the operation and maintenance of state veterans' cemeteries; establishes the gift for veterans' cemetery operation and maintenance to provide revenue to such fund; such a gift may be made on a taxpayer's personal income tax return in whole dollar amounts.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to establishing a gift for veterans' cemetery operation and maintenance which may be made on personal income tax return; and to amend the state finance law, in relation to establishing the New York state veterans' cemetery operation and maintenance fund

bills.title: Allows taxpayers to contribute to the support of the animal population control fund by marking a space on a corporate or personal income tax return
bills.summary: Allows taxpayers to contribute to the support of the animal population control fund by marking a space on a corporate or personal income tax return.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to contributions to the animal population control fund

bills.title: Prohibits certain discriminatory practices against victims of domestic violence
bills.summary: Prohibits certain discriminatory practices against victims of domestic violence relating to housing, including but not limited to, the purchase, rent, lease or housing accommodation; defines domestic violence victim to include victims of domestic violence pursuant to the social services law and victims of stalking offenses.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to prohibiting discriminatory practices against domestic violence victims

bills.title: Requires the state liquor authority to provide not-for-profit establishments at least 30 days on all billing related matters
bills.summary: Requires the state liquor authority to provide not-for-profit establishments at least thirty days on all billing related matters.
bills.actClause: AN ACT directing the state liquor authority to exempt not-for-profit companies from the fifteen day billing cycle

meetings.notes: Please note Date, Time and Room Change for this weeks meeting.
Please note date and time change for this meeting.nnTHE COMMITTEE WILL CONSIDER THE FOLLOWING NOMINATION:nnDavid A. Weinstein as a Judge of the Court of Claims.

bills.title: Relates to apportionment of state aid for libraries, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts
bills.summary: Relates to apportionment of state aid for libraries, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts; provides for extending the effectiveness of certain chapters relating to educational programs.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to apportionment of state aid to libraries and library systems, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts; to amend chapter 756 of the laws of 1992 relating to funding a program for work force education conducted by the consortium for worker education in New York city, in relation to effectiveness of such provisions; to amend chapter 425 of the laws of 2002, amending the education law relating to the provision of supplemental educational services, attendance at a safe public school and the suspension of pupils who bring a firearm to or possess a firearm at a school, in relation to the effectiveness of such chapter; to amend chapter 101 of the laws of 2003, amending the education law relating to implementation of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; to amend chapter 147 of the laws of 2001, amending the education law relating to conditional appointment of school district, charter school or BOCES employees, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; to amend chapter 57 of the laws of 2008 amending the education law relating to the universal pre-kindergarten program, in relation to extending the provisions thereof; to amend chapter 386 of the laws of 1996, amending the education law relating to providing for a waiver allowing state aid in certain circumstances, in relation to extending education, in relation to extending the provisions thereof; to amend chapter 169 of the laws of 1994 relating to certain provisions related to the 1994-95 state operations, aid to localities, capital projects and debt service budgets, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 82 of the laws of 1995, amending the education law and certain other laws relating to state aid to school districts and the appropriation of funds for the support of government, in relation to the effectiveness thereof

meetings.notes: The following nomination is before the Senate Finance Committee for consideration nnNirav Ramesh Shah, M.D. Commissioner of HealthnnS 2026 to be committed to the Rules Committee

bills.title: Reduces the required minimum age for obtaining a junior archery license
bills.summary: Reduces the required minimum age for obtaining a junior archery license from fourteen years to twelve years of age.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to reducing the required minimum age for obtaining a junior archery license

bills.title: Provides for lifetime sportsman license for honorably discharged, disabled veterans
bills.summary: Amends the environmental conservation law, in relation to providing for lifetime sportsman licenses for honorably discharged, disabled veterans.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to providing for lifetime sportsman license for honorably discharged, disabled veterans

bills.title: Requires the department of environmental conservation to prepare a report on the economic impact of hunting, fishing, and wildlife-associated activities in New York
bills.summary: Requires the department of environmental conservation to prepare a report on the economic impact of hunting, fishing, and wildlife-associated activities in New York.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to preparing a report on the economic impact of hunting and fishing; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof

bills.title: Authorizes DEC to designate additional fishing events as rehabilitation for armed forces veterans or active members
bills.summary: Authorizes DEC to designate additional fishing events as rehabilitation for armed forces veterans or active members.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to fishing events as rehabilitation for members of the United States armed forces

bills.title: Provides for the return of lost hunting dogs
bills.summary: Provides that any dog that has been released from their confinement for hunting purposes shall be deemed to be under the reasonable control of its owner while engaged in hunting or returning from hunting.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to lost hunting dogs

bills.title: Provides that persons participating in a fishing class or clinic sponsored by a school or university are exempt from fishing license requirements
bills.summary: Provides that persons participating in a fishing class or clinic sponsored by a school or university are exempt from fishing license requirements.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to providing that persons participating in a non-commercial fishing class or clinic sponsored by a school or university are exempt from fishing license requirements

bills.title: Allows hunters in the county of Chautauqua to hunt bear and deer by the use of a rifle
bills.summary: Allows hunters to use a rifle during open season for deer and bear in the county of Chautauqua south of route 20.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to allowing the use of rifles for deer hunting in the county of Chautauqua;

bills.title: Authorizes the catching and possession of up to 5 times the daily limit of fish during any 7 day period of time
bills.summary: Authorizes the catching and possession of up to 5 times the daily limit of fish during any 7 day period of time; authorizes the catching and possession on a single vessel of the maximum daily limit for each species of fish a person aboard the vessel is authorized to take.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to authorizing the catching and possession of five times the daily limit for any species of fish during any seven consecutive day period and authorizing the catching and possession on a single vessel of the daily limits of any species of fish for which a person aboard such vessel holds a license for the taking thereof; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof

bills.title: Allows hunters to use a rifle during open season for deer in the county of Cortland
bills.summary: Allows hunters to use a rifle during open season for deer in the county of Cortland.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to allowing the use of rifles for hunting in Cortland county

bills.title: Allows local tax collectors to send tax statements by electronic mail to an address provided by a homeowner and to opt out of receiving paper statements
bills.summary: Allows local tax collectors to send tax statements by electronic mail to an address provided by a homeowner and to opt out of receiving paper statements of taxes.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to allowing statements of taxes via electronic mail

bills.title: Authorizes local governments to deliver proposed local laws to members of their legislative bodies by means of e-mail
bills.summary: Authorizes local governments to deliver proposed local laws to members of their legislative bodies by means of e-mail.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the municipal home rule law, in relation to authorizing the electronic transmission of proposed local laws to members of a local legislative body

bills.title: Amends the NY government reorganization and citizen empowerment act
bills.summary: Amends the NY government reorganization and citizen empowerment act, relating to the requirements for consolidation or dissolution of certain local government entities.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the general municipal law and the municipal home rule law, in relation to the requirements for consolidating or dissolving certain local government entities

meetings.notes: Please note Date, Time and Room change for this meeting

bills.title: Requires the New York state energy research and development authority to submit an annual report detailing energy efficiency portfolio standard and approving program
bills.summary: Requires the New York state energy research and development authority to submit an annual report detailing energy efficiency portfolio standard and approving programs.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to requiring the New York state energy research and development authority to establish the energy efficiency portfolio standard and approving programs

bills.title: Directs NYSERDA to undertake a statewide study of consumer behaviors with respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology
bills.summary: Directs NYS energy research and development authority to undertake a statewide study of consumer behaviors with respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology programs.
bills.actClause: AN ACT directing the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority to undertake a statewide study of consumer behaviors with respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology programs

bills.title: Relates to the definition of alternate energy production facilities
bills.summary: Adds lithium ion energy batteries to the definition of alternate energy production facilities.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to the definition of alternate energy production facilities

bills.title: Relates to encouraging public-private partnerships to help spread broadband deployment
bills.summary: Relates to encouraging public-private partnerships to help spread broadband deployment.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the state technology law, in relation to encouraging public-private partnerships to help spread broadband deployment

meetings.notes: John Sabini, Chairman of the New York State Racing and Wagering Board will address the Committee.

bills.title: Defines the crime of surreptitious surveillance; rebuttable presumption that such surveillance under certain conditions is for no legitimate purpose
bills.summary: Defines the crime of surreptitious surveillance, a class B misdemeanor, when a person, for purposes of his or her own amusement, or for the purpose of degrading another person, or for his or her own sexual arousal, or for no legitimate purpose, surreptitiously observes by means of the unaided eye or an imaging device, intimate parts of an other person without that person's consent and at a place and time when such other person has a reasonable expectation of privacy; includes a rebuttable presumption that such surveillance under certain conditions is for no legitimate purpose; makes such offense a class B misdemeanor.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to the crime of surreptitious surveillance, a class B misdemeanor

bills.title: Relates to sanctions for driving while ability impaired while holding a conditional license
bills.summary: Relates to sanctions for driving while ability impaired while holding a conditional license.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to sanctions for driving while ability impaired while holding a conditional license

bills.title: Establishes a person is guilty of grand larceny in the fourth degree when he or she steals property and is in possession of an anti-security item
bills.summary: Establishes a person is guilty of grand larceny in the fourth degree when he or she steals property and is in possession of an anti-security item; makes criminal possession of an anti-security item a class A misdemeanor.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to the possession of anti-security items

bills.title: Defines the terms "impaired" and "intoxication" for the purposes of the vehicle and traffic law
bills.summary: Defines the terms "impaired" and "intoxication" for the purposes of the vehicle and traffic law.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the definitions of the terms "impaired" and "intoxication" for the purposes of such law

bills.title: Authorizes use of closed-circuit television for the testimony of domestic violence victim witnesses in a criminal proceeding
bills.summary: Authorizes use of closed-circuit television for the testimony of domestic violence victim witnesses in a criminal proceeding subject to the same restrictions as are applicable to child witnesses.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to authorizing the use of closed-circuit television for vulnerable domestic violence victim witnesses

bills.title: Expands geographical jurisdiction for crimes attendant to identity theft or unlawful possession of personal information
bills.summary: Expands geographical jurisdiction for crimes attendant to identity theft or the unlawful possession of personal information.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to expanding the geographical jurisdiction for crimes attendant to identify theft or unlawful possession of personal identification information

bills.title: Increases the penalty for crime of criminally negligent homicide
bills.summary: Increases the penalty for the crime of criminally negligent homicide by changing such offense to a class D felony from a class E felony.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to criminally negligent homicide

bills.title: Allows a court to preclude disclosure of jurors' names and addresses; repealer
bills.summary: Allows a court to issue an order precluding the disclosure of jurors' names and addresses upon a showing by the people that such an order is necessary to prevent bribery, jury tampering or physical injury to, or harassment of, the jurors or prospective jurors.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to anonymous juries and to repeal subdivision 1-a of section 270.15 of such law relating thereto

bills.title: Prohibits the use of radar and laser blocking devices in all motor vehicles
bills.summary: Prohibits the use of radar and laser blocking devices in all motor vehicles.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to radar and laser blocking devices

bills.title: Prohibits operation of any motor vehicle equipped with device which affects the operation of traffic-control signals
bills.summary: Prohibits the operation of any motor vehicle equipped with a device which affects the operation of traffic-control signals; provides that the possession of such a device shall constitute a traffic infraction, use thereof is a class A misdemeanor, and use which results in personal injury or death shall constitute a class E felony.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to prohibiting the use of any device which affects the operation of a traffic-control signal

bills.title: Relates to theft of credit card and debit card account numbers
bills.summary: Relates to theft of credit card and debit card account numbers.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to theft of credit card account numbers and debit card account numbers

bills.title: Relates to expanding the offenses to which a child witness may testify by use of closed-circuit television to include murder
bills.summary: Relates to expanding the offenses to which a child witness may testify by use of closed-circuit television to include murder.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to expanding the offenses concerning which a child witness may testify by use of closed-circuit television to include murder therein

bills.title: Relates to creating a hazard
bills.summary: Provides that any person who shall abandon in a public place, any controlled substance or dangerous drug as defined in article 220 or 221 of the penal law, shall be guilty of creating a hazard.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to creating a hazard

bills.title: Creates crimes of cemetery desecration of a veteran
bills.summary: Creates crimes of cemetery desecration of a veteran as a class E felony; makes corresponding changes in cemetery desecration crimes in the first and second degrees and aggravated cemetery desecration in the first degree; makes additional penal provisions.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to cemetery desecration and cemetery desecration of a veteran

bills.title: Provides that no person convicted of certain felonies may not file for change of name while incarcerated or under supervised release therefor
bills.summary: Provides that no person convicted of certain felonies defined under specified laws of this state may file a petition for change of name while such person is incarcerated or under supervised release therefor.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the civil rights law, in relation to prohibiting certain felons from changing their names

bills.title: Relates to the offense of sexual abuse in the first degree
bills.summary: Provides that sexual contact upon a person under the age of 13 by a person 21 years of age or older shall be sexual abuse in the first degree.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to sexual abuse of a person under the age of thirteen

bills.title: Relates to authorizing child witnesses to testify by use of closed-circuit television in assault and endangering the welfare of a child proceedings
bills.summary: Relates to authorizing child witnesses to testify by use of closed-circuit television in assault and endangering the welfare of a child proceedings.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to authorizing child witnesses to testify by use of closed-circuit television in assault and endangering the welfare of a child proceedings

meetings.id: meeting-Veterans, Homeland Security and Military Affairs-2-2011-2011

bills.title: Authorizes granting of school tax exemption to veterans with at least forty percent disability
bills.summary: Provides that after a public hearing a school district may adopt a resolution providing a school tax exemption on residential property owned by a veteran with at least a forty percent disability; provides that in order to qualify for such an exemption, an individual shall submit to the assessor a certified statement from the bureau of veterans' affairs stating that he has a permanent service related physical impairment which limits such individual's major life activities by at least forty percent.
bills.currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to an optional school tax exemption for certain disabled veterans

bills.title: Provides that the ballots of deceased military personnel shall be counted toward the election for which they were cast
bills.summary: Provides that the ballots of deceased military personnel shall be counted toward the election for which they were cast.
bills.currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the military law and the election law, in relation to the counting of ballots of deceased military personnel

bills.title: Enacts the New York state veteran health insurance act
bills.summary: Enacts the New York State veteran health insurance act.
bills.currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law and the military law, in relation to the establishment of the New York state veteran health insurance act

bills.title: Provides a preference in state contracts for service-disabled veteran owned small businesses
bills.summary: Provides a preference in state contracts for service disabled veteran owned small businesses.
bills.currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to state contract preference for service-disabled veteran owned small businesses

bills.title: Establishes the New York State veterans cemetery act
bills.summary: Establishes the New York State veterans cemetary act.
bills.currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to the establishment of the New York State veterans cemetery act

meetings.committeeName: Veterans, Homeland Security and Military Affairs
meetings.notes: Please note the location change for this meeting.nnDirector of the Division of Veterans Affairs WilliamKraus will be appearing before the Committee to discuss Veterans issues.

bills.title: Relates to apportionment of state aid for libraries, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts
bills.summary: Relates to apportionment of state aid for libraries, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts; provides for extending the effectiveness of certain chapters relating to educational programs.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to apportionment of state aid to libraries and library systems, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts; to amend chapter 756 of the laws of 1992 relating to funding a program for work force education conducted by the consortium for worker education in New York city, in relation to effectiveness of such provisions; to amend chapter 425 of the laws of 2002, amending the education law relating to the provision of supplemental educational services, attendance at a safe public school and the suspension of pupils who bring a firearm to or possess a firearm at a school, in relation to the effectiveness of such chapter; to amend chapter 101 of the laws of 2003, amending the education law relating to implementation of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; to amend chapter 147 of the laws of 2001, amending the education law relating to conditional appointment of school district, charter school or BOCES employees, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; to amend chapter 57 of the laws of 2008 amending the education law relating to the universal pre-kindergarten program, in relation to extending the provisions thereof; to amend chapter 386 of the laws of 1996, amending the education law relating to providing for a waiver allowing state aid in certain circumstances, in relation to extending education, in relation to extending the provisions thereof; to amend chapter 169 of the laws of 1994 relating to certain provisions related to the 1994-95 state operations, aid to localities, capital projects and debt service budgets, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 82 of the laws of 1995, amending the education law and certain other laws relating to state aid to school districts and the appropriation of funds for the support of government, in relation to the effectiveness thereof

bills.title: Relates to apportionment of state aid for libraries, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts
bills.summary: Relates to apportionment of state aid for libraries, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts; provides for extending the effectiveness of certain chapters relating to educational programs.
bills.actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to apportionment of state aid to libraries and library systems, teachers of tomorrow teacher recruitment and retention program and duties of school districts; to amend chapter 756 of the laws of 1992 relating to funding a program for work force education conducted by the consortium for worker education in New York city, in relation to effectiveness of such provisions; to amend chapter 425 of the laws of 2002, amending the education law relating to the provision of supplemental educational services, attendance at a safe public school and the suspension of pupils who bring a firearm to or possess a firearm at a school, in relation to the effectiveness of such chapter; to amend chapter 101 of the laws of 2003, amending the education law relating to implementation of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; to amend chapter 147 of the laws of 2001, amending the education law relating to conditional appointment of school district, charter school or BOCES employees, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; to amend chapter 57 of the laws of 2008 amending the education law relating to the universal pre-kindergarten program, in relation to extending the provisions thereof; to amend chapter 386 of the laws of 1996, amending the education law relating to providing for a waiver allowing state aid in certain circumstances, in relation to extending education, in relation to extending the provisions thereof; to amend chapter 169 of the laws of 1994 relating to certain provisions related to the 1994-95 state operations, aid to localities, capital projects and debt service budgets, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 82 of the laws of 1995, amending the education law and certain other laws relating to state aid to school districts and the appropriation of funds for the support of government, in relation to the effectiveness thereof
